alert.note: Alert for Noxubee (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 13 at 10:34AM CDT until July 13 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Noxubee County in east central Mississippi... * Until 430 PM CDT. * At 1034 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Macon. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Macon, Shuqualak, Paulette, Mashulaville, Prairie Point, Gholson and Cooksville. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
